name: Francisco Bay Inn

reviews.text: This "Inn" is horrible! First, it starts out with a man coming to the reception desk with no shirt on! Then we get to the room and open the door - the smell on ammonia overwhelmed us. Then we really started to notice the room. It was just a bed in the middle of one room and another room that had the toilet, sink and bathtub/shower. Very under impressed for the price I was paying.
reviews.title: Inn or Brothel?
Recommend highly!
reviews.text: We are trying to relax for only a minute when we see something fly past the window. We look outside and see that something was thrown from the top floor and narrowly missed a vehicle. Things are not looking good at all. Then we start to hear all of the traffic. How are we ever going to sleep? So trying not to touch anything – we quickly change and leave for diner and the concert we were going too.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we got back for the night, there were no parking spots available. They have stacked parking and two handicap spots. I need the handicapped spot and was disappointed to see both of the spots was being used illegally. So we were forced to park behind someone in the stacked manner.
reviews.title: Fantastic Experience.

likes.liked: — The location to Lombard St and the busy street.
likes.disliked: — The parking was tight but not a problem I have a compact car.

reviews.title: Loved the Francisco Bay
reviews.text: 30 minutes later (now after midnight) we get a call in the room from the front desk. They ask if we can bring our keys to the front desk. So I stay in the room and wait as my fiancée goes down to the front desk.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Moments later she returns and says, "Get packed! We are not staying another minute!" She explains how there was an obvious prostitute with her pimp waiting for her to leave her keys at the front desk with the manager (who appeared shirtless when we first arrived) because the car we parked behind had to be used.
reviews.title: Warm Friendly Clean and Homey

likes.liked: — The staff and the Location but mostly the price
likes.disliked: — I had no complaints. There was nothing that stands out as being disliked. It was a great place to stay.

reviews.text: The San Francisco Bay Inn ended up being a good little deal for our family of four, including two children. We stayed in a clean, newly-remodeled room that faced an alley, as opposed to the busy and noisy street. Very close to bus stops and walking distance to Lombard Street. The best feature was the free parking. Don't expect much of the continental breakfast, fresh donuts and Tang (that's the hotel's version of "juice"). Overall, it was a good value.
reviews.title: Good Deal

reviews.text: This Inn (aka Motel) is the worst travel experience of my life. The management is super rude and inconsiderate. We had booked online at the hotel website and I called to confirm the day of our trip and they showed no reservation for us. The women manager assured me that she did not have the reservation and that she would make me a new one, under my name instead of my boyfriends name who we booked the one online under. The weather was so terrible that our flight got canceled into SF, and we had to cancel our reservation. She assured me she understood and canceled my reservation. HOWEVER, we got my Boyfriends credit card bill and she charged us for the reservation she claimed she could not find. I called numerous times and tried to get it resolved and she said that she never said that and that I would just have to "deal with it" She hung up on me four times! PLEAS SAFE YOURSELF THE MISERY AND STAY ELSEWHERE!
reviews.title: Horrible, Terrible, Just Plain RUDE

reviews.text: The location of this hotel was the only good thing. Right off of Lombard Street, we could walk pretty much anywhere. However, that does not cancel out the RUDENESS of the front desk staff. They were totally unwilling to help with anything and gave attitude anytime we asked a question. I will never stay here again! The room was also very small and not clean. Bad hotel!
reviews.title: Rude desk staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was acceptable but not for over 200.00 a night. Elevator didn't work, continental breakfast a joke and full of flies. The most infuriating thing was the desk clerk ( possible owner) lied when bookinig tickets for a tour. Told us she needed a cash deposit as was required by the tour operator. We paid her cash and later found out at the tour that she simply lied and cheated us out of the cash "deposit." Would have paid her a fee gladly for booking the tour but instead she chose to lie and cheat. Do not stay here.
reviews.title: Desk clerk ripped us off

likes.liked: — Location was acceptable is you can walk far

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I do not understand how this place has a 3star rating. The rooms are tiny. The rooms smell bad, so we had to buy odor neutralizer to be able to stay there. The bedding does not look all that clean, we slept in our clothes. they advertise themselves as an inn, but be warned, this is a MOTEL. The only reason we even bothered staying at this motel which we booked in advance, was that we arived after midnight and I could not get a room at another hotel on the same night (I called and tried). On top of this, the staff is not all that friendly.
reviews.title: dont stay here, unless you want a 2 star motel
Location, location, location.......
reviews.text: Yes, this non-chain hotel is a little loud but you really can't beat the location or the parking. We too were warned about the lack of parking spaces and the ominous threat of tickets so with a rental car, we were a little dubious. The Francisco Bay Inn is exactly what the reviews say. Smaller, independently run, spotlessly clean and close to many SF attractions. We noticed the traffic noise too but were able to block it all out by simply closing the window. There was a small fridge and microwave, a charming retro elevator, creative parking and extremely polite staff. The breakfast was an afterthought so you should know that going in. We stayed 3 nights (booked online) in mid-September and would definitely go back again. Compared to the other chain hotel rates starting at around $160 (sometimes not incl. parking), this place was a steal at $99 for the weeknights and only slightly higher on the weekend.

reviews.title: Overall pretty good but be careful
reviews.text: Overall, a place worthwhile but not suitable for everyone.
Pros:
reviews.title: Stayed 8/31/04-9/3/04 , most reviews are Right on
simple, clean; watch price and cancellation policy
reviews.text: 1) Free parking - apparently most hotels in the city of SF charges for parking, I got quotes of up to $45/day. Some of the spaces are a little tight but then again so are most spaces (if you can actually find one) in SF.

reviews.title: Terrible terrible terrible
reviews.text: 2) Friendly staff - Jay at the reception was very friendly. Even informed us of areas of SF to avoid. Always helpful.

reviews.title: Free Parking, Good Location, Excellent Value
reviews.text: A medium size Motor Inn in the heart of the city. I don't think you can find a better value especially if you have a car to park. The location is great, took me only 15mins to walk to the wharf through decent neigborhoods. I booked here because of free parking (up to a $27/day value) but I ended up not having a car. No mattter. The inn is handy to public transportation and/or pleasant walks. My room had 2 Queen size beds, a dresser, a desk, window A/C, a small fridge and microwave and a huge white tiled bathroom. Everything was neat and clean. There was no enclosed closet, but a valet rack held all my hangup items. The staff was friendly and helpful. This is an older but very well kept property so don't expect the rooms to be decorated like a 5 star resort, but more like a high end Motor Inn from years past. To summerize with one word, "Comfortable". I love this place, and plan to stay here whenever I visit San Francisco and have a car.

reviews.title: Great hotel but alot of traffic noise
reviews.text: The staff and rooms here are great. We spent Sunday, Monday nights and a Friday night. The rooms are not huge but definetly big enough for us. They are clean. Our only complaint was the noise level at night. The hotel is located right on the highway leading to and from the Golden Gate Bridge. The traffic noise in the front of the hotel was very loud on Sunday and Friday nights. Also if you call the hotel you can get a better rate (for us $25/night) then if you go through one of the web sites. Overall it was a nice experience and a very clean hotel with great staff.

reviews.title: Great Value
reviews.text: A great value and location. Rooms are small, but clean and very comfortable. Staff was extremely helpful in helping us navigate the SF.

reviews.title: A great deal!
reviews.text: We stayed two nights at the Francisco recently and everything turned out very well. The location is supurb -- walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf, Lombard St. hill and the colorful Russian Hill neighborhood. Parking was tight but available, which was such a prize in this city with so few available spaces. And the staff was very nice, efficient and helpful. We had a late flight in so arrived after midnight, but because I called ahead and warned them of this situation they had our room ready and waiting. The rooms were spacious and clean, and looked recently renovated. I'd recommend this hotel anytime, especially for the price.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Don't go there!The first room smelt, the toilet was boken,like the light, it was directly on the street ,we couldn't sleep because of the rumors and most of all because the light of the neon sign on our window. The lady, maybe the chef,was very peevish and arrogant. The first time we asked for another room, first they told us it was possible, but when we came back in the evening we still had the same terrible room. The third night we had a better room, still stinking!
reviews.title: bad!to forget!

reviews.text: We read reviews before booking this motel & decided to try it even though there were some not so good reviews. The main thing you do need to know is that you do want to book a room at the back of the motel, do to the heavy traffic noise on this street.
reviews.title: Take notes before booking room

likes.disliked: — Front desk person needs to pay attention to correct credit card info. at check in / Cleaning person dumped a whole entire pot of my own personal coffee/ No hanger to put on outside door to refuse cleaning service.

reviews.text: Also be sure that if you are going to use a different credit card to pay for your room then what you used to reserve it online, make sure that they are charging the right credit card. I handed the man my credit card and he did not even notice that it was different then the one that I reserved the room with, so they ended up charging it to the one I did not hand him. Because of this we had no money in our checking account and we were charged by our bank a fee to transfer money over from our savings account.
reviews.title: Excellent for the price

reviews.text: Even after finding out & telling them that they did this, they did not offer to pay us back the transfer fee.
reviews.title: A pleasant surprise

likes.liked: — size and comfort of rooms, location, price

reviews.text: I had also brought my own very expensive decaf coffee and had made an entire full pot, and while we were out the maid decided to dump out an entire full pot of coffee. When I asked at the office why she would dump a full pot of coffee out, there answer was I must not be used to staying in clean motels.
reviews.title: Bad Customer Service

reviews.text: Miserable reception from unhelpful people. Everything was too much bother. The "breakfast", if you can call it that was the cheapest donuts (flies included at no extra cost!), the worst kind of coffee dust and bananas that were rancid beyond belief. The soup kitchen at Golden Gate Park was more hospitable and the food looked better quality.
reviews.title: Avoid at all costs.
loved it
reviews.text: Coming from France we spent seven days there, touring around. The room was perfect. Very tidy and comfortable. We stayed on the good side of the building, meaning not direct to Lombard Street - interstate 101. Location is great by the way. One or two times we had trouble parking the car though, late at night. We cooked ourselves breakfast but had coffee and muffins down at the reception. Very nice hard working people. Good souvenir.

reviews.title: Beware!!!
reviews.text: Avoid staying at all cost!!!! Don't let the price/location/value fool you. I was double-charged for my room and they refused to fix the problem. I had booked the room online and they tried to convince me that I must of pressed the confirmation button twice, which I didn't and even if I had done that, wouldn't the hotel realize if an order was placed multiple times that something must be wrong with that picture.

To justify my position, I always call the hotel to confirm my reservation a day or two before arriving. I did the same thing in this case and they NEVER told me about any multiple bookings. I even asked if there were any extra rooms available and they adamently said no and that the hotel had been sold out.
reviews.title: Great place and good location

reviews.text: The room is as small as a walk-in closet, even for the 1 king-sized bed that I got. It is by far the smallest hotel room that I have ever seen. there is hardly any room to walk around the bed, its basically a bed placed in a tight room.
reviews.title: Do not stay here !

description: Located on San Francisco's famous Lombard Street - home to the Golden Gate Bridge and 'The Crookedest Street in the World' - The Francisco Bay Inn provides spacious, comfortable accommodation for thousands of travelers each year. Our recently renovated rooms coupled with our excellent service will help make the Francisco Bay Inn a special part of your stay in San Francisco. Our amenities include FREE parking, FREE limited breakfast, FREE wireless high-speed internet access, In-room microwave / refrigerator, In-room iron / ironing board, cable TV, and FREE tour pickup. The Francisco Bay Inn is AAA approved and a member of the San Francisco Convention and Visitors Bureau.
